definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: Fortunately, the fire is discovered soon after it has started.
sentences.chinese: 幸好火勢剛起就立即被發現了。

sentences.english: Open doors can provide enough draft so that a fire can run wild.
sentences.chinese: 打開門會提供足夠的氣流更會使火勢蔓延。

sentences.english: Heavy wind at the time was another factor.
sentences.chinese: 當時的風颳得很大是引起這樣大火勢的另一個因素。

sentences.english: The fire is sprawling in all directions.
The fire was quenched with a bucket of water.
They cut down some trees to knock down the fire and prevent it from spreading further.
sentences.chinese: 他們砍倒了一些樹以控制火勢，使火不再蔓延開去。

sentences.english: The fire has burned down to a spark.
sentences.chinese: 火勢減弱只剩下一點點火星。

sentences.english: Because of the strong wind, the woods fire beyond control.
sentences.chinese: 由於風勢強勁，森林火勢變得無法控制。

sentences.english: Instead, the fire blazes out of control.
sentences.chinese: 相反，火勢已經失去控制。

sentences.english: The fire began abating just before midnight (11:00 a.m. EST).
sentences.chinese: 在午夜前，火勢開始減弱。

sentences.english: On November 22 the fire in the San Gabriels was out of control.
sentences.chinese: 十一月二十二日，聖加百利山上的火勢一發不可收拾。

sentences.english: A lamp exploded in one of them near the shore and the fire speedily spread.
sentences.chinese: 其中一條靠岸的船上的油燈爆炸，火勢迅速蔓延。

sentences.english: Warnings were issued to people living downwind of the fire to stay indoors.
sentences.chinese: 已經向住在火勢下風處的人們發出不要出門的警告。

sentences.english: A change of wind checked the fire.
sentences.chinese: 風向的轉變阻止了火勢的蔓延。

sentences.english: Leaves that are high in cellulose, or that contain oils, also stoke the flames.
sentences.chinese: 纖維素含量高或含油的葉子也助長了火勢。

sentences.english: The cloud is a pyrocumulonimbus cloud, a powerful thunderstorm that forms over large fires.
sentences.chinese: 這團雲霧是由下方兇猛火勢積累形成的強大的雷暴。

definition: to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
to start out on a trip/to dispatch troops
to find/to track down/to recover (sth lost)
